thread.title: Mann, Gaines looking to push Georgia to new heights
thread.title_full: Mann, Gaines looking to push Georgia to new heights

author: The Marietta Daily Journal (noreply@mdjonline.com)
title: Mann, Gaines looking to push Georgia to new heights
text:
October 23, 2015 02:30 PM | 271 views | 0 | 4 | | Georgia head coach Mark Fox answers a question during the Southeastern Conference men's NCAA college basketball media day in Charlotte, N.C., Wednesday, Oct. 21, 2015. (AP Photo/Chuck Burton) slideshow 
ATHENS, Ga. (AP) â€” Senior guards Charles Mann and Kenny Gaines are proud of Georgia's accomplishments over the last two seasons. 
The Bulldogs won 41 games, earned an NCAA tournament bid and finished tied for second and third in the Southeastern Conference. 
For Mann and Gaines to help Georgia go farther this season, the team's top priority is staying healthy. Last season was taxing as injuries sidelined starters a combined 21 games after the first week of January. 
Mann had to play multiple positions while Gaines suffered through several setbacks and needed surgery to repair a broken foot in the offseason. 
Coach Mark Fox says Gaines and junior guard Juwan Parker, who's recovering from Achilles surgery, have been monitored closely in practice this month. 
___
